text: my name is josh dean and i used to fancy

much i hope my father-in-law is not

product to improve your baseball swing
the way it works is you take this mount
you take a bat you stretch the elastic
mount over the end of the bat then you
slip the sensor and and you're ready to
go it's that simple the sensor transmits
data to your phone we're a sleek app in
fine baseball fashion presents you with
all kinds of measurements including the
speed of your swing my first conclusion
is that I am too old to be attempting to
swing at the speed of a college baseball
player on the driving range you can get
some help with your swing from a product
called swing bite which also costs 150
dollars the hardware attaches to any one
of your golf clubs with the help of

measures things like the path of your

hit the ball the limitations are going
to be akin it can it help you correct
them I mean you're gonna need a golf pro
to correct what the things we're doing
wrong hitting some balls of the club pro
I stumbled over a few technical issues
one is it the claps keep snapping open
and that's
not a huge deal the other problem is a
little bit more troubling that the data
seems to be inaccurate at least on the
angle of the clubface later I tested the
system with new hardware and everything
worked fine on the basketball court we
encountered a bigger problem people
probably think that I'm just text
messaging but I'm actually
troubleshooting my basketball the 9450
promises to provide a dribbling and

hundred dollars the technology measures
variables like the arc and speed of your

drills but at first the ball didn't
connect to my phone and again I had to

a 40 year old man who occasionally plays
sports is not the target audience for

about improving your game this
technology could give you an edge
